text: Belle Plaine is a city in Sumner County, Kansas, United States. In 2020, 1,467 people lived there. ==History== Belle Plaine was created in 1871. Belle Plaine is a French name, and it means "beautiful plain". In 1883, Belle Plaine was a station and shipping point for the Southern Central & Fort Scott Railway. By 1910, it was at the junction of two railroads, the Missouri Pacific and the Atchison, Topeka & Santa Fe. The first post office in Belle Plaine was created in April 1871. ==Geography== Belle Plaine is at (37.393428, -97.279548). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . All of it is land. ===Weather=== Belle Plaine has hot, humid summers and generally mild to cool winters. Of the households, 70.7% owned their home and 29.3% rented their home. The median age was 37.8 years. Of the people, 89.3% were White, 1.4% were Native American, 0.5% were Black, 0.1% were Asian, 1.5% were from some other race, and 7.1% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 5.9% of the people. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 1,681 people, 630 households, and 466 families living in Belle Plaine. ==Education== Belle Plaine is a part of Belle Plaine USD 357 public school district. ==References== ==Other websites== ;City * City of Belle Plaine * Belle Plaine - Directory of Public Officials * Belle Plaine Chamber of Commerce ;Schools * USD 357, local school district ;Historical * Belle Plaine Historical/Genealogical Society ;Maps * Belle Plaine City Map, KDOT Category:Cities in Sumner County, Kansas Category:1871 establishments in Kansas
